item.title: Kelley add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "Who has a right to tell me I have no gift, no talent, no passion ...' he murmured. 'Why do people say those things to you when youre young? Doesn't seem fair, does it?' 'No, darling, it's not fair,'she said. 'But the mystery is why you listen." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Kelley add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "If drugs really numb your consciousness, they'd be a good thing. As it was, they slowed you down, confused you, kept you vulnerable to violent flashes of recall, and then agitated you and made you unsure of what you knew and didn't know." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Kelley add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "Phil was mumbling that Reuben might become a writer after all and writers had a way of "redeeming everything that ever happens to them." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Kelley add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "I'm hoping what all sentient beings hope ... that somehow I'm part of something larger than myself, in which I play a role, an actual role that is somehow intended and meaningful." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Kelley add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "You killed them, Reuben. You killed them in their sins! You terminated their destiny on this earth. You snatched from them any chance for repentance, for redemption. You took that from them. You took it all, Reuben. You snuffed out forever the years of reparation they might have lived! You took life itself from them and you took it from their descendants, and yes, even from their victims, you took what their amends might have been." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Kelley add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "He was so excited by this little bit of intelligence that he might have gone off, perplexed, pondering for a long time. It was like reading a wonderful sentence in a book, and not being able to continue because so many possibilities were crowding his mind." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Kelley add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "Laura remarked that science was dependent upon poetry, that all scientific description was metaphoric." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Kelley add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "I will write things, he was thinking. I will write something meaningful and wonderful someday. I can do that. And I'll dedicate it to you because you're the first person who ever made me think I could." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Kelley add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "Dear God, help me. Do not forget me on this tiny cinder lost in a galaxy that is lostâ€“a heart no bigger than a speck of dust beating, beating against death, against meaninglessness, against guilt, against sorrow." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Kelley add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "Say what you will to the force that governs the universe. Perhaps we'll call it into being, and it will yet love us as we love it." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Kelley add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "He had never expected death to be this quiet, this secretive, this easy." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Kelley add a quote by coco chanel
item.description: "I don't care what you think about me. I don't think about you at all." -- coco chanel
